title: Bank of England fires warning shot at Facebook over Libra digital currency
text:
The Bank of England has hardened its stance over Facebook's plans for a digital currency, saying the Libra initiative will have to meet the “highest standards of resilience”.

Minutes of the Bank’s Financial Policy Committee said the social media giant would have to provide enough information to allow regulators to monitor payments as well as proving the operational resilience of the entire payment chain “in advance” of any launch.

Governor Mark Carney, who held talks with Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg over the currency this summer, said in June that the Bank had an “open mind but not an open door” over Libra.

The FPC has now struck a tougher tone.

The currency is due to launch next year...
